rdf:Class.rdfs:label: Span of text
rdf:Class.rdfs:comment: A span is a sequence of characters that occurs verbatim in a text, either contiguous or discontiguos as extracted by SPaR.txt (Kruiper et al., 2021). It may contain a determiner (`the building`), may be plural (`buildings`) or may the boundaries of the span may not be extracted correctly (`buildi`).

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: Consitutes
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Indicates that a span constitutes another span, e.g., the Multi-Word Expression (MWE) Span `hot water storage system` the Span `storage`. This object property MAY indicate that the Spans are related, e.g., through an `is-a` relation.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: Is Morphologically Similar To
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Indicates that a Span is morphologically similar to another Span, e.g., they may have the same stem or a small Levenshtein distance. This object property MAY indicate that the Spans are related, e.g., they may be alternative labels for the same skos:Concept.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: Is Semantically Similar To
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Indicates that a Span is semantically similar to another Span, following a cosine similarity between their embeddings. Distributed semantics capture notions of occuring in similar word contexts, and may be weighted using based on the frequency of their occurence in documents (IDF weighted). This object property MAY indicate that the Spans are related, e.g., they may be alternative labels for the same skos:Concept.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: Has Acronym
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A Span can have an acronym, e.g., `British Standards Institute` has the acronym `BSI`. This property relates the full text Span to the acronym Span. Note that this is usually a data property of a concept ~ see e.g. https://w3id.org/mod#acronym.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: Is Acronym Of
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A Span can have an acronym, e.g., `BSI` is the acronym for `British Standards Institute`. This property relates the acronym Span to the full text Span. Note that an acronym is usually a data property of a concept ~ see e.g. https://w3id.org/mod#acronym.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: Is Antonym of
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Reflexive property that relates a Span to another Span, each being each other's antonyms. We primarily expect to use WordNet's antonyms. The use-case is as follows; IF a Span has a semantically similar Span that has a irec:constitutes relation to some Span that has an antonym, then any Span that constitutes the antonym span should not be returned. Consider, e.g., how `cold water storage` should not be returned for a query on `hot water storage`.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: Domain of Span
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Indicates the domain of a Span, based on the textual domain(s) in which the span was found and several relevant measures.
